The provided Node.js code is a module that re-exports all the exports from two other modules: `configurations` and `user-agent-middleware`. It uses the `tslib.__exportStar` function to handle the re-exporting, which is common when working with TypeScript to manage module exports. The `Object.defineProperty` is used to set the `__esModule` property to `true`, which is a part of handling ECMAScript module compatibility. The commented line at the end indicates that this file is a compiled version with a source map for debugging purposes.

Below is the rewritten version of the given code without using `tslib`, while maintaining the re-export functionality:

```javascript
"use strict";
Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });

const configurations = require("./configurations");
const userAgentMiddleware = require("./user-agent-middleware");

Object.keys(configurations).forEach((key) => {
    if (key !== "default" && !exports.hasOwnProperty(key)) {
        exports[key] = configurations[key];
    }
});

Object.keys(userAgentMiddleware).forEach((key) => {
    if (key !== "default" && !exports.hasOwnProperty(key)) {
        exports[key] = userAgentMiddleware[key];
    }
});
```
